name: Kenny
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
We should've booked a longer stay!
One, passing-through night at this idyllic country location is just not enough. Do yourself a favour and sample the real world - the original escape from whatever ails you in a quick-paced, modern environment - at Alma and Jason's Fresh Fruits Farm for a few nights or more.
Alma's and Jason's descriptions of 'FFF' are accurate and faithful, but they're also understated - try describing peace, tranquillity, normality and exceedingly tasty omelette in your average Air BnB ad. We loved our single night stay here, wish we'd stayed longer.
Incidentally, McComb is a lovely and quaint wee town that offers more then you'd imagine; also wished we'd had more time to take it in.
Thanks, A&J
Best wishes, Kenny & Patti (Glasgow, Scotland)

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This is a most peaceful and beautiful location. Very private and well off the road and away from traffic noise. At night (when it’s clear obviously), the stars are vibrant and visible. Even the “tiny” ones. If that’s your thing. But, who doesn’t like looking at God’s magnificent solar system, right? I spend most of my nights sitting outside in the back of my truck staring at the sky. (Chairs work too 😉)
Breakfast is hand made and hot upon delivery. None of that “heat it up out of the box” stuff. Very filling and tasty.
Ms. Alma is always quick to respond with any questions, if you have any, and makes sure that the initial check in is most pleasant and easy accessible.
This my second time staying, and surely not my last. A true sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle, nosy big city life.

review_text:
This was absolutely the most peaceful and quiet place I have stayed. To include my own home. Far enough off the road that you could not hear traffic going by. It is very secluded from others, yet such wide open space that you can just feel the nature.
There was a hot breakfast waiting on me when I woke up. A ham and cheese omelet with hash browns and biscuits. My favorite. I felt at home.
Unfortunately, my trip wasn’t for vacation this go around, but I have definitely found a new “go to” location when I am home visiting family in the area.
If you are looking for a quiet get-away from all of the hustle and bustle and just need to clear your mind, or just passing through and need some rest in a very comfortable bed before the next hitch of the trip, this IS the place.

It was a place I would go again and I pray that your blueberry crop does better next year.

My reservations from nights before were now booked, and I had nowhere to stay. I found Alma's place on AirBnB and contacted her. This was late in the day, but she helped me out and made it work for me. I got there after dark and left before daylight, so unfortunately I never even got to see the farm. The farm house is awesome though and was perfect for me. I had zero issues with anything. The wall mounted A/C in the room was awesome because it made that perfect fan/compressor combo sound that reminded me of staying with my grandma when I was a kid. Slept like a baby :)

name: Michael
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2020
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
THIS PLACE IS WHAT I ALWAYS STRIVE TO FIND, “A DIAMOND IN THE ROUGH!”
If you’re looking for natural country beauty, southern hospitality, and a place that is full of unknown surprises...this is the place! Yes, it is small and quaint, but everything is ridiculously clean providing the Southern Hospitality Charm that everyone is always looking for.
Jason & Alma are the most gracious hosts, caring couple, and go well above and beyond the definition of what we think hospitality is. No one will ever go wrong in choosing this hidden gem. I wish everyone who discovers this magnificent breathtaking property enjoys their stay!
I will be back very soon with my kids.
Very Respectfully,
Captain Michael Bergey
USMC

The porch swing is where we spent the mornings drinking our coffee and where we spent the evenings just taking it all in. Mrs. Alma and Mr. Jason were awesome and even cooked us breakfast with fresh blueberry muffins. If you're in the area i wouldn't hesitate, just book and enjoy. Just simply amazing.

name: Andre
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2018
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Alma and Jason are the perfect host, and the home is perfect for a romantic, scenic, relaxing and healthy vacation. You will enjoy walking the private path and enjoying the vegetation, or picnicking on the lush grounds.
The property and their private guest house sits on 65 acres of beautiful pastures, trees, and blueberries. On the property there are honeycombs that produce honey.
Breakfast was amazing. The omelette was prepared using fresh eggs from their chickens with homemade jam. The blueberry muffins as you can imagine came from their farm.
If you like farm to table, peace and tranquillity, and nature you will have to book a stay.

Stayed with kids
review_text: This place is BEYOND incredible!!!! Unbelievably clean and tidy! They are amazing hosts. The house smells so good & the view can't be beat! There is covered parking available. If you are looking for a quiet & romantic getaway this is the place! There is a chaise available for a small child but not ideal for a family with more than 1 kiddo. We enjoyed eating dinner on the covered patio & watching the rain storm on the swing. The breakfast was incredible. Can't beat farm fresh food! We were so thankful for a sweet Christian couple to enjoy! Humble, kind, Godly people who are eager to love on others.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: The peace and solitude this cabin provides is beyond comparison! The photos of the property don’t do it justice. It’s absolutely gorgeous, and they’ve thought of every detail to make it as comfy as possible. The bed and all the furniture is really comfortable, they provide a giant ice maker downstairs, there are multiple options for relaxing outside (2 porch swings, a hammock, a picnic table, a giant deck, a kids swing, a game area, and a fire pit. My favorite part of the property was the screened in giant porch! So relaxing and you don’t have to worry about mosquitos! Our dog had an even better vacation than we did! She loved wading in the water and with no neighbors nearby, she was able to be leash-free a good part of the time (she sticks by us). This was the most truly relaxing vacation I’ve ever taken!! No traffic noise, no hustle and bustle, and no people! Total perfection! We hope to make this a vacation spot several times a year.

review_text: Overall loved our stay! We loved being able to use the kayaks and explore down the river. The water was super low so sometimes we had to get out and walk but it was still really cool to see everything that would usually be under water. Only two main cons for us was that we didn’t expect the neighbors to be so close with having plain view of each other and it could’ve been a little cleaner. Mainly just dust, hair, etc. Nothing that would make us not want to come back but would appreciate more attention to small details.

My husband & I had some good laughs playing ping-pong. I think I could possibly live on the back porch. We enjoyed the record player and drinks in the evening. This place was super clean! The bed was also very comfortable. The only thing, I was disappointed about, was not being able to enjoy the river but that's Mother Nature. I loved watching the squirrels in the morning and we got to see a deer. We’d definitely recommend it and hope to come back ourselves. Thanks for sharing your beautiful retreat!

review_text: We had a wonderful stay at The Blue Heron. It was so tastefully decorated, cozy, great little games, and unique touches. A morning on the screened porch with a cup of coffee was so peaceful. The property felt really secluded, but it didn't take long to get to a store if you needed. We were traveling with a toddler and he loved the place - the outdoor tub was a hit! And we felt really safe wading into the river with him - actually it was kind of ideal - the current was easy, you can just lounge in a camp chair and cool off with your feet in, and he was able to splash around and enjoy the water. We would return in a heartbeat!

name: Jen
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The Blue Heron Cabin is magic. Its petite and cozy inside and so spacious and private outside. I loved being able to still be outside on the screened in porch when the bugs came out or the sky opened in a thunderstorm. The outdoor shower was lovely and refreshing. It was great to disconnect from the outside world, and there was so much to fill time with should you need it. A dvd collection that took me way back in the best way possible, lawn games and table games, and a record player with some great records. So many places to nap and read (the hammock was my favorite), write, watercolor, whatever you felt inspired to do. And then there's the river to sit in, swim in, float in, watch flow whatever your heart fancies. I feel so refreshed and filled up after just a few days away. On my next visit I'll remember to bring my water sandals, an inner tube to float on in the river and a few of my favorite records. Book now you wont regret it! Thanks Scott and Alice for hosting me!

Though our stay was short we spent one entire day exploring up river in the kayaks that were provided and then enjoyed a pleasurable float back down to the cabin.
We also enjoyed having our evening meals on the screened in porch. Though not quite as secluded as we would have hoped it was still an enjoyable adventure and somewhere we would like to return to with our family.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Amazing location, and a great place to escape the city and enjoy nature. The cabin was comfortable and had everything that was needed.
I did have problems the first day/evening due to the neighbors dog. The dog was at the cabin when we arrived, it is the neighbor across the rivers dog. The dog is people friendly (no manners though and jumps on you nonstop) however, it is not dog friendly and attacked my service dog I had with me. To stop a fight I had to put my dog back in the car and wait over an hour for the neighbors to calm their dog back. The dog returned three times the first day/evening and would circle the cabin barking if anyone moved. This meant we were not able to enjoy the river or the grounds at all in our only non-rainy day we were there. For the price it was disappointing.
I understand it’s not the owners fault and out of their control but for being advertised as dog friendly it was not for my stay. I would think twice about bringing a dog.

Alice and Scott have curated a peaceful and modern cabin aesthetic in the interior. The exterior is well-equipped with everything you need for maximum enjoyment of the area. The riverfront is well-kept and entry into the river is very easy. It is an easy 15-20 minute drive from all useful stores.

We were concerned because it was going to be below freezing both nights we were there, but the house stayed cozy and warm! The bedroom is very small but with blackout curtains and hotel-quality comforter and sheets, we got terrific sleep. Can’t wait to visit again when it’s a little warmer for kayaking. Huge thanks to Alice & Scott. You can really tell how much they’ve put into this place!

review_text:
Overall, this is a lovely property and beautiful location - we had a nice time with our infant daughter on her first trip. The place is well-decorated and very private. I would note that the bedroom is extremely small compared to how it seems in photos (approximately 2 feet of space on one side of the bed, no space on the others) -- we did not expect just how small it was and so we had to have our infant sleep in another room, which was not ideal.
There were a few issues that I raised for the hosts which were not addressed during our stay. The most significant of these was a major bug problem in the kitchen -- throughout the drawers, cabinets, and countertops. We had to throw away a significant amount of food. Unfortunately, the outdoor lights did not work on the porch or on the lower level, which limited our use of those areas in the evening. I raised these issues to the host as they arose via Airbnb message and they said that they would address them for future guests.
After the stay, I received an intimidating phone call from the host in an attempt to take communication off-platform. Ultimately, they provided a partial refund to account for the bug problem.

review_text: Blue Heron Cabin is pretty awesome. Tucked away in the woods and about 30 steps from the rivers edge. Our dog loved running and swimming in the water. Rivers pretty shallow right in front of the house. We kayaked (4 kayaks for you to use) upstream a little ways and found some deeper spots. Cabins got pretty much everything you need (ie pots, pans, salt & pepper, gas grill etc). No Wi-Fi and pretty much zero Verizon coverage (AT&T service worked ok). Which was fine. It’s nice to disconnect a bit. Bedroom is tiny and bunk beds are really not comfortable for adults. But the couch is comfy and so was the outdoor furniture on the screened in porch. This place was great and we’d definitely go back. We had 4 adult guests (any more than that and it would be way too crammed).

This was a perfect weekend getaway! It was relaxing and it was great to just unwind from everyday life. Cabin is just as pictured inside and out. It was squeaky clean upon arrival and even though it accepts dogs, you would never know a dog was there (granted our dog came with us). Since it was last minute booking I was glad they accepted dogs. I don’t know who had more fun if the dog or the kids. We spent our days outside, the river was low so the kids got to play in it, we used the kayak and fished a little.
The cabin has EVERYTHING you would need. I suggest bringing food/snacks before arriving that way you don’t have to leave the cabin at all. There is no wifi, which we didn’t mind, and one dvd player (bring dvd movies if you have kids).
It fit our family of 4 perfectly. We will definitely come back!

If it is peace and quiet you are looking for this is the place!! Back porch is screened in and is great for morning coffee and listening to birds. Inside is very clean! They have DVD and a good collection of movies already there. Very nice gas grill! Shower had very good pressure and hot water didnt run out. Going to make plans to return and hopefully soon!

name: Anna
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2022
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text: This is absolutely the perfect getaway spot! Couldn't have asked for a better home base, or nicer hosts. The cabin is close enough to civilization to be able to drive to the grocery store and check out the cute antique shops and boutiques in downtown Summit, but far enough away that you hear nothing but birdsong and the gentle river breeze when you're sitting out on the front porch in the morning. At night there's a lovely dark sky for doing a little stargazing on clear nights. We booked the cabin with the intention of going kayaking on the river and building fires in the firepit each night, but to be honest, the cabin was so cozy that we ended up spending all of our "at home" moments relaxing either in the comfy living room or on the gorgeous, breezy screened in porch. There are ample hiking and fishing spots within an hour's drive of the cabin, and we loved adventuring out to Percy E Quin State Park and to the Natchez Trace for some adventuring. The cabin kitchen is so nicely appointed that we abandoned all plans for outdoor grilling and made good use of the cast iron pans indoors on the stove. I can't believe I'm saying this, but it's actually a pleasure doing the dishes after dinner in that gorgeous farmhouse sink, too. It was a little too cold to try the outdoor shower or the outdoor tub, but those are two fabulous touches that probably come in super handy during the summer with dirty pups or kids after an awesome day playing out in the yard. There are also plenty of indoor and outdoor games to keep kids or restless adults entertained, too. Alice and Scott have truly thought of everything. We were sad to leave, but hope to be able to come back again soon!

At night the cabin looked magical with the lights on, like something out of a magazine or movie, photos do not do it justice. There was tons to do, darts, ping pong, cornhole, everything was easy to find. Everything was very convenient, there was a hose right next to the kayaks to spray our feet off & an outdoor shower. Kayaking down the river was my favourite bit, besides a couple houses along the river there was no sign of mankind. And we did see a blue heron!

review_text: We had a great time and the property is so peaceful and beautiful! We are so appreciative when we find vacation spots that allow our pups to come with us. They loved swimming in the river and exploring the property! The large decks are great and the hosts did a good job of providing essentials. I do feel the property could use some TLC. The amenities that are advertised left something to be desired. We found cornhole bags but no boards. There were 3 kayaks that were kept upside right so they were full of water and very dirty, and there was only 1 paddle. The dart board and charcoal grill are on their last leg. I love that they had some extras, just wish they were in better shape. Otherwise, we had a wonderful stay!

name: Lauren
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
My daughter and I had a great time here just relaxing and enjoying nature. We would not have seen a single person, except there was work being done on the lot next door. The property is very well kept. The grass was freshly cut. I appreciated the child's life vest and large floaties. We were able to just walk around in the river as it was very shallow. The porch is just amazing to sit outside and relax. I appreciated the cozy mugs and plethora of coffee available!
I was slightly disappointed with the way the games were stored. We had to dig around to find things and there were lots of equipment types of things laying around, like pipes on the ground. We couldn't find the cornhole game in the picture. The full-size bed was very squeaky, lamps were wobbly, and the hammock was coming apart. It didn't ruin the trip or anything- we enjoyed the other swings available. Just a few little updates would make this perfect like the pictures.

name: Christina
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
My family and I came for a few days during my kids’ fall break.
The outside grounds of this cabin are very peaceful and relaxing. We had a very fun time spending time together. However, the cabin could benefit from just a little more TLC. Several pieces of furniture need to be repaired/replaced. The hammock outside was starting to become unwoven in the middle. The bed in the bedroom squeaks every time you move a tiny fraction of your body. I believe this could be fixed easily with a different frame.
Pros: Kayaks are provided by the owners. Also several different floaties for little ones. Linens/blankets and bathing products provided are very nice. Nice river for kids to play it with railing to step down into. Lots and lots of fun games and books are provided.
Cons: Cabin was not as clean as we would have liked. The hot water in the bathroom shower does not get very hot and does not last long enough for more than one person to shower. Bathroom had a strange smell the whole time we were there.

review_text:
Forever grateful to Alice & Scott for sharing their little slice of river front heaven. We’ve stayed at several cabins in and around area and by far this is one of our favorites. Everything you need or would want is all in one place and such a quick escape from where we live. Water was lovely, dog friendly, family comfortable and just too darn cute. Property is beautiful and well maintained. Floating on the river was dreamy.
Ice maker is a game changer and so appreciated so you don’t have to haul or run to store. So is the outdoor shower!
Loved the hibachi!
Directions are spot in, easy to find and gravel road is well maintained. Even arriving after dark you wouldn’t have a hard time identifying the fence or address. It’s a hop, skip and a jump to gas/convenience store or to Summit. Town has everything you would need.
Love the options in and around area to explore.
Do not look any further. If you love fun in the sun, splashing in and on the river, relaxing or just unplugging and getting back to nature this is the place.

But a small flatscreen tv and antenna that we had on hand came in perfect. As far as our pup she loved it and the screened in porch was perfect to just sit out for hours. Once we got there we never left! Looking forward for a return trip in a few months

This older home has all the charm of southern antebellum homes. The furnishings are so fitting and it is decorated perfectly! You can tell that a lot of love and thought went into making this space really stand out. We felt right at home and couldn’t stop talking to everyone we encountered while in town about how nice it is. This is a space where you want to come and stay for a while. It is just outside of town allowing you to feel like you are in the country but close enough that a trip to town was not a burden. I highly recommend this country retreat! Stacey is a wonderful hostess and made sure that we had everything we needed!
P.S. Bring tennis shoes so you can enjoy the tennis court!

If you have the opportunity, I absolutely recommend staying in this airbnb.

Where to start! What a lucky find this was for us! We're on a roadtrip from New Orleans and found this beautiful spot to stay for a night. Kendra responded immediately to our last minute booking and proved clear directions and instructions. We arrived and were greeted by the beautiful, friendly Blaze and sweetest little Cookie the kitten! They were the cherry on the top for us at this place!
The cabin far exceeded our expectations. Kendra has thought of everything! Comfy beds, spotlessly clean and so spacious for 4 of us (travelling with adult kids).
We had the best relaxing evening sat on the porch with a glass of wine, reading our books and enjoying the beautiful views and peaceful surroundings.
The only downfall was that we couldn't stay for longer!
Thank you, Kendra and family, for an absolutely beautiful stay. We will be back for longer, on our next visit from the UK.

review_text: If you are an able bodied person, this place is great. However, if you are unsure on your feet or have a small child, it is not quite as accommodating. The steps outside could use railings and the shower could use a slip resistant mat or something along those lines. My son, DIL, and my 15-month-old grandson staid for about a week and there was no child-proof anyway and no booster seat. But, it was still an enjoyable stay and the host was very nice. I would definitely recommend the place, but people with babies should take along some outlet covers, a booster seat, a wash tub and things along those lines.

review_text:
Staying at this cabin is relaxing and peaceful. Kendra is a wonderful host and has thought of all the right touches for a short or long stay. The cabin always smells lovely upon arrival, and there are complementary coffee, teas, and snacks that add to the welcoming atmosphere. For the winter, there is central heat and a space heater in the living room. The bed is very comfortable, and the linens are crisp! The bathroom is spacious and has a shower with great water pressure. There’s also a washer and dryer that are very handy. The location is just secluded enough and is really quiet and peaceful. There is a small pond with a swing hung by it you can enjoy in the sunshine.
All in all, this cabin has all the right touches for comfort and relaxation. After just one day, it feels like “home!” I will absolutely be back and already cherish my time on Firefly Lane.

review_text:
1905 Cabin was everything we hoped for & more! It was a tree-house retreat. Beautiful surroundings, wide open spaces to hike, private & included just the right balance of being off the grid that we were looking for. The outdoor shower & jetted bath tub were some of our favorite amenities. The grounds are so well-cared for. The time & love that this family puts into their property can be see in all the little details. Stone Hedge was a super cool feature! The views from the back deck over the bottom were breathtaking-taking! There’s charm at every turn.
We hiked, visited the chicken coop, found different places to watch the sunset, picnicked, grilled & enjoyed bubble baths under the stars. We were very fortunate to meet one of the owners & learn some of the farm’s story. There are so many details that you will discover as you explore. Follow all of Ainsley’s instructions about what to bring & you will have the most amazing experience! We will be returning very soon!

review_text:
Love at first site! As soon as we arrived, we knew we’d picked the right spot. The farm is beautiful; trails are cut through the whole property -just enough so you can take all the walks you want but it’s not so manicured that it loses the rustic charm.
Communication with the hosts is superb. The digital guidebook provided answers to every question you have about to your whole visit from check in to check out.
The cabin is very livable- good furniture and bed, spaces for every need: functional kitchen, dining space, relaxing space, work space, and very comfortable bed. The outdoor space is even better; they’ve created so many amenities: huge multi-level deck with lots of seating, a jetted tub, an outdoor shower, a fire pit…something to use and enjoy in any season.
We started planning our next visit within the first hour of arriving. Great spot, great hosts!

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This rustic farmhouse took us back in time and was a neat way to celebrate my husband’s 75th birthday. We spent several days relaxing on the deck and the porch, swinging in the hammock and enjoying the trees and birds and deer. We walked the property and soaked in the outdoor spa tub, explored Percy Quin State Park and bought milk and cheesecake at Mauthe’s Progress Milk Barn. One day we drove over to the Lynard Skynard Memorial and were amazed by the number of young people stopping by who weren’t even born when the band’s plane crashed. We dipped our toes in the Bogue Chitto and ate catfish and shrimp at Stogner’s. Ainsley was very quick to respond when we had questions, self check-in was easy, check-out instructions were clear. The place was clean and quiet, with no neighbors in sight, whimsically decorated—-a real country getaway.

review_text: Everything was perfect. It was like a cottage straight out of a storybook. After a little while of letting the air in and letting the AC run, the house was a very comfortable temperature. The grounds were perfectly green, stonehedge was very well maintained, the trails through the woods were well worn and easily navigable. It’s the PERFECT place for a weekend getaway outside of city life, if you need a reminder of how beautiful nature can be. Very thankful for this trip, will absolutely be visiting again!

name: Miera
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Fantastic area to get away and cozy farmhouse to relax in! The reviews and description are exactly right on. This place was perfect.
My husband, son, and two pups stayed four nights. Our goal was to RELAX and this far exceeded our goals. Felt secluded and private~ just enough. But also basic amenities are within a short drive. We cooked all our meals here, and the kitchen is great. Wifi and phone service (Verizon) worked fine, not always super fast but enough and just as described in the listing. The TV was kinda slow, but perfect for my son at night before bed. You can sign in to your Netflix, etc. And we honestly wanted to be disconnected so none of these were concerns for us.
Take the time to visit Mauthe's Dairy, the cheesecake and chocolate milk were very memorable for my husband's birthday. Delicious!
We visited at a very hot time, so we kept our hikes short, but the little amount we did were very enjoyable. Loved visiting the chicken coop and the tree nursery is very cool to hike around! We hope to visit again at a time when it's less than 100 degrees so we can spend more time exploring outdoors and doing campfires. Beautiful landscape and scenery all around the cabin and farm. We were able to stay very cool hanging out in the awesome outdoor bathtub~we wore swimsuits and there were bubbles available, it made for a very fun way for the family to keep cool on a record breaking hot day. The back deck is amazing! We grilled and enjoyed the hammock and there are many seating options for coffee/drinks/hanging out in the shade. The front porch is so quaint, and very cozy during a thunderstorm. Although we never got to use the firepit, we really enjoyed moon & stargazing from the seating there. I'm sure I'm leaving something else great out, but everyone enjoyed our stay here very much, dogs too!

review_text: The Fortenberry Farm experience is absolutely breathtaking! My husband and I stayed in the 1905 Cabin for a honeymoon weekend getaway and never wanted to leave. Outside we would just stand there listening to the sound of the breeze moving through the meadows, song birds, echoes of farm animals and the crackling of our fire. We felt like we had jumped into a Beatrix Potter novel. We didn’t see any other visitors and we explored the whole farm so it felt like we had the place to ourselves. Ainsley and her family were very attentive to our questions and we couldn’t critique a single detail. Wifi and reception worked perfectly, we even got to watch Netflix on the tv. There is a speaker system that you can hook your phone up to and play music throughout the house and deck. At night we soaked in the hot tub on the deck and there were fireflies everywhere. I could go on and on but in summation it’s magical and we will be returning ASAP!

name: Blake
rating_info:

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
My wife and I were only able to get away Thanksgiving week this year so we wanted somewhere private and secluded. Just somewhere to get out in the wilderness and disconnect from society for a few days. Ainsley’s place was exactly what we were looking for. Plenty of space to walk and explore, an outdoor fire pit and indoor fireplace, as well as a beautiful outdoor deck area to just hang out and BBQ or relax in the hot tub. There are plenty of dead sticks and tinder to pick from the property to make your own fires without having to haul a bunch of firewood. My wife enjoyed the deck hammock overlooking the garden Stonehenge and was able to read a large portion of her 800 page novel. One thing to consider going in - since this is a rural area - the internet is not the greatest - not that my wife and I were complaining. If you have children, you may want to bring some movies to watch on the Blu-Ray player. Sunset for us was about 5pm so we entertained ourselves by playing cards and reading and relaxing by the indoor fire. There are a selection of novels and board games to choose from as well. All and all, just a very peaceful, quiet vacation which was much needed.
PS - bring your flashlights. At night, I was able to spot several deer on the property!

name: Vickie
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This rustic cabin is located on beautiful property. The outside has a relaxing deck with a nice hot tub which is clean & comfortable. The back deck is a perfect spot to enjoy a cup of morning coffee.
The cabin is decorated in a variety of rustic, island, steam punk, & vintage decor. The kitchen has a coffee pot, pots, pans but I suggest cleaning them before. There is a microwave, stove & refrigerator that is clean & new. Bring your own food, coffee, condiments & even bottled water as none are provided. The bathroom has a wonderful shower but bring your own toiletries including a blow dryer. (None was provided even though it was stated.). The downstairs bedroom has a queen bed & two single beds are upstairs. They are in fair condition but clean.
There were several house rules & a list of check out request I felt were annoying & unnecessary. Read the list before you book. The night before check out I was sent a list of request that I needed to do before I left such as strip the beds & take out the trash, wash dishes, clean the bbq pit, throw the ashes in the woods, etc. Of course I clean up after myself but if I'm stripping beds & taking out trash, what is the $88 cleaning fee for? We were there 2 nights so there wasn't much to clean. It was difficult to relax when I was given a list of request that had to be done, as well as a reminder to leave on time.
I was sent an update & charged $96 when I left after letting her know a head of time we would have an additional guest. Be sure you know, 2 guest is the price quoted in the ad & $50 more for each additional guest per night. Cameras are mounted outside & checked to verify number of guest.

We will definitely be staying again!

name: Wendy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The cabin and property are amazing! I cannot express just how wonderful of a stay we had, and pictures are not able to show the true splendor of the place. The cabin is lovelier and roomier than I imagined. A few things are as rustic and basic as I had expected, but the artwork and rugs and special touches all over the place make for such an incredible vibe. The property, with all the plants and trees and hills, is absolutely stunning. We went on several hikes, covering different areas and seeing new things each time. We stayed 6 nights and only left twice. Once to go to McComb for groceries and to get takeout from Wilson BBQ & Soulfood Express (HIGHLY recommend), and once to spend the afternoon at Red Bluff (also HIGHLY recommend). We each borrowed a walking stick from the porch, and they really came in cutch for the more difficult parts of the descent and climb. The loft, with its comfy futon couch and front facing windows, is a remarkably nice spot to enjoy in the afternoon. There was an abundance of easily collectible and dry firewood on the ground, and the fireplace in the dining room and the firepit outside were set up with everything else. There were even a couple of nice rocking camping-type folding chairs in the bedroom closet that we thankfully used around the fire pit. And the hot tub! Not only is it very nice and clean and large, its place out on the deck in total privacy makes for a surreal experience at night. Winter was a perfect time to stay at 1905 Cabin, but I look forward to going back in the Spring to see if it the grounds can possibly be any more beautiful. My partner and I are the always-prepared type, and it served us well as always. I recommend bringing a hatchet or small ax for firewood and a utility lighter, extra towels, easy slip-on shoes for walks out on the porch and deck, and full-size mugs if one drinks coffee. We did not use the grill, but there were several left-behind bags of charcoal. I can’t believe I almost passed on renting the place because of the double bed. It was a little firmer than my preference, but coziness of it actually really suited the romantic nature of the place.

Ainsley and her team were incredibly attentive, offering quick responses whenever I sent any messages. The cabin its-self was very well decorated and cozy, even with the colder weather outside. The kitchen was beautiful and had everything we needed for meals. We especially loved using the fireplace which we were able to run using sticks and fallen branches we found around the property. The only thing to consider, and i'm sure this is stated in the listing, is that the largest bed is a double size which can be uncomfortable but not enough that I wouldn't stay here again. Ainsley's place is a great getaway from NOLA and we will definitely be back if she'll have us!

rating_info:

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The pictures don't do this place justice. It is just the coolest - chock full of folk art, rustic beauty, and unique reclaimed pieces. Perfect spot to surprise my husband with a relaxing birthday weekend getaway. You can chill in the hammock, soak in the hot tub, or explore the grounds -- the rope swing is not to be missed!
Tips for fellow travelers: Bring coffee. Also booze, if you plan to imbibe: Nearby Tylertown appears to dry, so there's no picking up a bottle of wine at the grocery store. Be sure also to pack an extra pair of flip-flops or other slip-on footwear. The hosts don't allow shoes inside, which is fine, but we found that we were constantly fetching shoes back and forth from the front porch to the back deck. Trust me, you will appreciate having some simple footwear you can just keep by the back door to slip on and off as you come in and out from the deck (which is itself one of this property's best features). The host provides fuzzy slippers, which is a nice touch, but I didn't want to wear them outside.
All in all, this was a wonderful experience. We loved our stay at the 1905 Cabin so much that we already have plans to return every year -- or whenever we feel the need to get away from it all and recharge our batteries.

review_text: We enjoyed our stay at the 1905 Cabin! It was a bit drafty inside until we figured out the gas heater, but the hosts were responsive and the temperature wasn’t an issue after that. If you’re planning to cook in the kitchen, you may want to bring your own seasonings, dish towels, and paper plates, as those amenities were a bit spare, but the brand-new appliances were great!

We it was mere friends thats enjoyed this beauty, but one thing thats certain is we absolytely loved it, and provided we are fortunate enough we shall return!
I have been back in Nola near 3 years and haven't found tgat special place to do spiritual retreats, but this is it! Alone time with Fod and his wonders can be found at the 1905 Cabin. The Hosts were amazing too, quick to respond, and and pleasantto speak to. Thw Hot Tub is a Huge hit for most. I would recommend this Precious Gem to anyone!

name: Cheri
rating_info:

,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This cottage is completely charming in every way! From the scent of gardenias blooming by the porch steps to the delightful vintage fixtures throughout, we felt enchanted by the house. The owner's have lovingly restored the building adding modern conveniences while retaining all of the architectural details of a 100 year old house. Their fantastic primitive art collection adds considerably to the interior ambiance. If you put the co-ordinates given into your GPS, you will be directed right to the entrance. The house seems completely isolated from any outside noise. You are sharing the space with only the small wildlife of the area, and two friendly neighboring dogs who playfully make the rounds in the morning. The only disappointment was that the 2nd bedroom, with twin beds, was located in an un-airconditioned attic bedroom. This will likely not be an issue for any guests staying in cool weather, but it was too warm for us to use during late May.

review_text: I was at the 1905 cabin this past weekend to celebrate my 30th birthday with two of my best friends. We needed a low-key place to catch up and relax, but feel like we were still on a vacation. This place was beyond perfect, stocked with anything we could have needed, and everything we had questions about were answered almost immediately. The weather got really severe (we now know there was a confirmed tornado in the location) and the power went out, but the hosts met us with a bag full of emergency supplies and even offered to let us stay at their home if we needed to. We ended up staying at the cabin and riding it out, but we still had one of the best weekends! I highly recommend this cabin to anyone looking for a getaway of any kind. I don't doubt that we will be back in the future.

He did not feel it was a safe location for our Black family, as the beauty of the pool and lakeside view from the pics were not seen as he drove towards the home. Perhaps it is hidden behind the trees. Unfortunately, the area was very eerie, dark, and forest-like. & the landscape (trees, bushes, grass) appeared unkept where there was also a wrecker-truck near the home which didn't help with the asthetics. This home was not viewed in the daytime nor the inside of the home. We decided it was safer for our family, which included an infant and 6-yr old, to inconveniently spend the extra costs for a Hotel

This place is a hidden gem!

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the cabin! My partner and I enjoyed the seclusion and the fact that we only had to leave for groceries. The farm was beautiful and we were able to go to the chicken coop for our breakfast eggs. I will say, however, my issues only happened once we left. I put my partner in charge of leaving the keys in the lock box (probably a mistake) but he assured me he did. Instead, he left them in the door which was something we did not realize until after our check out. Payment was attempted to be collected for lost keys and small glass found in the garbage disposal. I know we did not break anything or use the garbage disposal, so I had asked them to adjust the request and I would be happy to pay for a cleaning fee for my pup we brought. I had spoken with the host prior to arrival saying I was bringing a dog and we agreed on a $100 fee, but I was not going to pay for lost keys ($25) and a broken jar ($25). I received no response and I assume a bad review.

I will definitely be coming again.

It was amazing, the laughter, the conversations this place brought to me and my wife sharing our anniversary of 11 years was truly one for the books. I will most definitely recommend this place to anyone trying to just reconnect, we have already shared this location with family and friends. Get out of the busy city and out in the real country. Ainsley does a wonderful job of explaining this location and what to expect… just a extra note fill the hot tube about an hour before you are ready to relax , lol it provided a good two hour laugh and conversation for me and the wife . Me being ready to jump in excited as can be to site in the tub for an hour waiting for it to fill!!! Haha we had a blast! A must stay !!

rating_info:

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a GREAT place to stay. It is close to both Tylertown and McComb, and just down the street from Paradise Ranch- but when you are relaxing on the porch it is like you are a million miles from civilization. Inside has all the amenities one could want with internet, TV, beautiful decor, washer/dryer access, a fully functional kitchen, two bedrooms and two baths. The beautiful little creek is perfect for wading and rock hunting. The property is landscaped with plants native to Mississippi, and you can enjoy them all from the comfort of the breezy front porch - or screened in porch - or back patio - or side deck... a full 360 of outdoor views! There is a grill for outdoor cooking, a porch swing, and a large recreation area in the barn area out back that includes seating, corn hole boards, and other yard games. There is even a firepit with rustic seating for those chilly evenings.

review_text: Ainsley's place was beautiful and very comfortable for all of our needs. Despite the fact that we were there in freezing temperatures and grey skies, the charm and natural beauty of this place was still quite obvious! The owner went above and beyond to help us when our power went out due to the ice storm, assisting us to another of her cabins, which was a wonderful display of local folk art. We had such a nice time, even during the extreme weather, that we have already rebooked for a week in April! Love this place and the folks who run it.

name: Layna
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Our stay was really great! We were looking for something close by and was secluded. We brought groceries, bicycles, and books. The best part was the multiple porches. Most meals were eaten outside. We walked through the woods around the property our first day then used the grill. Next day, we went to the dairy farm nearby for homemade cheesecake (so good!) then for a bike ride. The roads are quite hilly and challenging, but it was a nice and scenic ride. The closest liquor/grocery store was over 20 minutes away so I was thankful we came prepared. Our last day, we hiked, used the firepit for a campfire and star gazed. The space was clean and charming. Loved the pink dishes. Also enjoyed ping-pong. I hope to return some day soon!

name: Holly
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2020
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text: I couldn't keep the kids out of the creek or my husband for that matter. I found an old porcelain Mason jar lid along the creek bed. We were so drawn to the creek that we never got to enjoy the trails. The property was beautiful, quiet, and peaceful. We admired the hummingbirds, a pair of hawks, an armadillo (named Andy), Gus the lizard and his numerous girlfriends as well as various tracks along the creek . The game barn was a cool place to hang out as was the screened in porch. It was a much needed restorative trip. The host helped make my Mother's Day all the more wonderful!
